intro: Primula henryi, commonly known as the Chinese primrose, is a herbaceous perennial native to China. It belongs to the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its clusters of bell-shaped, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with hairy stems and broad, heart-shaped leaves. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in woodland areas or rocky soils. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for garden cultivation.
